title: Into your hand
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company

description: A plea to preserve Australia's native animals. Describes the native fauna and how white settlement, expansion, and clearing land has effected them. Shows how animals such as the red kangaroo, possums, lizards, and ablbatross are caught and banded to enable scientists to study closely their living habits. Professor A.J. marshall questions random methods of pest killing.
